data.title: libpulse issue in exported game on linux
data.body:
When I build godot on linux I see this and it is expected because I don't use pulseaudio.

"PulseAudio development libraries not found, disabling driver"

Godot builds fine and it runs fine. But when I export my game it get this when I try to run the game:

error while loading shared libraries: libpulse-simple.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

So, I can not export and run any game.

data.title: File overwriting
data.body:
File system : 

**A.gd**:

``` GDScript
# A.gd
func _init():
    pass
```

**B.gd**:

``` GDScript
# B.gd
func _init():
    pass
```
- Open A.gd and B.gd in Godot and close them
- Rename B.gd with C.gd and A.gd with B.gd in the file system
- Reopen the files in Godot
- Here C and B have the same content, A is only available with the file system
- Close Godot, the scripts are saved and A is lost

An additional reason for don't save the unmodified scripts.

data.title: Can't push the "next tab" button when three tabs are in the same dock
data.body:
3 tabs in one layout spot, can't push the red marked button.

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4741886/9564569/e92243f2-4eab-11e5-8041-d71cbbe5e5a7.PNG)

data.title: [FR] Make Easing property available for export
data.body:
Sometimes it's handy to have a visual representation of the ease() function for transitions and stuff.

![Easing](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6296184/9560877/98aea792-4e03-11e5-95ed-5dddb3df8b8c.png)

Right now the Easing property is just an export hint for the editor. It would be helpful to have it available from gdscript as an export property.

data.title: Properly free enemies after death in 3d platformer demo.
data.body:
Previously, they stuck around as invisible physics objects. This fix is much
cleaner than my previous attempts, as it uses the ability to call a function
from an animation as is done in the 2d platformer demo.

data.title: Remote debug & live edit doesn't work on 2.0 alpha
data.body:
http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=12&t=1523

is this issue resolved?

data.title: In 3d platformer demo, remove enemies when they die.
data.body: Current version of platformer actually leaves dead enemies as invisible physics objects for you to trip over or use as stepping stones.  This is probably not intentional, so I wrote a simple patch that fixes it by waiting until the animation player reports being finished, then deleting the enemy.

data.title: Fix enemy.gd to actually remove dead enemies.
data.body: Previously, enemies sat around as invisible physics objects.  You could sometimes trip over it if it was in your way, or you could use it as a stepping stone.  I won't say the stepping stone part couldn't be interesting, but I'm fairly certain it was unintended.

data.title: Shift + Meta + Q is a System Shortcut and Triggers Log Out on Mac OS
data.body: Shift + Alt + Q would be better.

data.title: Fixed multiline comments
data.body: Fixes multi line comments, seen in issues [#929](https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/issues/929) and [#1320](https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/issues/1320).

data.title: [Discussion] Tabs and Scene tabs
data.body:
The purpose of this thread is to discuss the ideas and wishes around the Scene tabs of Godot editor. Multiple subjects have to be considered here and I ask every participant to quote precisely which one they relate (eg. S1 or G2).

Feel free to propose new entries for the following lists.

Considering tabs (in General) : 
- G1/ Close button : already PR-ed ( #2380 )
- G2/ Find a way to scroll horizontally over a big number of tabs
- G3/ Close tab with middle click : already PR-ed ( #2371 )

Considering scene tabs in the editor : 
- S1/ Left align the scene tabs instead of centering them.

data.title: Fixed misspelled local variable for code clarity
data.body: Specifically, tar(g)et_fps

data.title: Compiling issue on Mac OS X (no matching function for call to 'localtime')
data.body:
Hello. I noticed a bug (sounds like a little bug) with the installation on mac. One module is not being compiled because a function from the time.h library is not being found. Maybe the installation script is not calling it right?

```
scons: Reading SConscript files ...
sh: i586-mingw32msvc-gcc: command not found
sh: x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc: command not found
sh: i686-w64-mingw32-gcc: command not found
scons: done reading SConscript files.
scons: Building targets ...
g++ -o drivers/unix/os_unix.osx.tools.32.o -c -g3 -Wall -DDEBUG_ENABLED -DDEBUG_MEMORY_ENABLED -DFREETYPE_ENABLED -arch i386 -DDEBUG_MEMORY_ALLOC -DSCI_NAMESPACE -DAPPLE_STYLE_KEYS -DUNIX_ENABLED -DGLES2_ENABLED -DGLEW_ENABLED -DOSX_ENABLED -DMUSEPACK_ENABLED -DSQUISH_ENABLED -DVORBIS_ENABLED -DTHEORA_ENABLED -DPNG_ENABLED -DDDS_ENABLED -DPVR_ENABLED -DJPG_ENABLED -DWEBP_ENABLED -DSPEEX_ENABLED -DTOOLS_ENABLED -DGDSCRIPT_ENABLED -DMINIZIP_ENABLED -DXML_ENABLED -DETC1_ENABLED -Icore -Icore/math -Itools -Idrivers -I. -Iplatform/osx -Itools/freetype -Itools/freetype/freetype/include -Idrivers/unix/vorbis drivers/unix/os_unix.cpp
drivers/unix/os_unix.cpp:229:2: error: no matching function for call to 'localtime'
        localtime(&tv_now.tv_usec);
        ^~~~~~~~~
/usr/include/time.h:112:12: note: candidate function not viable: no known conversion from '__darwin_suseconds_t *' (aka 'int *') to 'const time_t *' (aka 'const long *') for 1st
      argument
struct tm *localtime(const time_t *);
           ^
1 error generated.
scons: *** [drivers/unix/os_unix.osx.tools.32.o] Error 1
scons: building terminated because of errors.
```

data.title: [UI] Need white space in class browser text area
data.body:
![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/223984/9489764/1e97f012-4bec-11e5-92d7-86264e3a2010.PNG)
A little bit of margin on top and left would improve the readability.

data.title: Array Editor, NodePath not selected properly
data.body:
When selecting node in array editor, value is set relative  to editor.

Expected: Should be set in a way that can be retrieved with get_node()

Example: It's currently set as "/root/EditorNode/bunch_of_editor_specific_nodes/my_node"

data.title: Array editor should initialise new elements contextually when increasing array size
data.body: When increasing size of Array, type of new element should copy the type of the previous element (if it exists). Now it initializes to Nil.

data.title: OSX_ENABLED not defined for server build on OSX
data.body:
Error: MSG_NOSIGNAL undefined
Reason: OSX_ENABLED not defined for server build on OSX. In drivers/unix/stream_peer_tcp_posix.cpp:
# if defined(OSX_ENABLED) || defined(IPHONE_ENABLED)

```
#define MSG_NOSIGNAL    SO_NOSIGPIPE
```

...
Error StreamPeerTCPPosix::write(const uint8_t\* p_data,int p_bytes, int &r_sent, bool p_block) {
...
    while (data_to_send) {
        int sent_amount = send(sockfd, offset, data_to_send, MSG_NOSIGNAL); /////ERROR HERE

Fix:

In platform/server/detect.py, replace

env.Append(CPPFLAGS=['-DSERVER_ENABLED','-DUNIX_ENABLED'])

with

if (env["osxserver"]=="yes"):
    env.Append(CPPFLAGS=['-DSERVER_ENABLED','-DUNIX_ENABLED','-DOSX_ENABLED'])
else:
    env.Append(CPPFLAGS=['-DSERVER_ENABLED','-DUNIX_ENABLED'])

and put the following in SConstruct:

opts.Add('osxserver','Required workaround on OSX when platform=server (yes/no)','no')

and add osxserver=yes to the scons command for this case.

One could use a different platform argument instead of adding this special case kludge, and I'm sure someone knows the preferred coding style or a better approach, which is why I'd appreciate some feedback before I make a pull request.

data.title: str(engine_type) should return a precise type name (like 'Sprite') instead of 'GDNativeClass'
data.body:
`str(engine_type)` should return `'engine_type'` (for example `'Sprite'`) instead of `'GDNativeClass'`.
`engine_type.get_type()` already return `'GDNativeClass'`.

A method `Object::get_class()` could be useful for obtain a reference to the native class (not only its name) from an instance.

data.title: Editor file-picker crashes when thread model is "single-unsafe"
data.body:
**EDIT:** I discovered that the crash only happen when the thread model is set to "single-unsafe".

Godot crashes if I try to add scripts to non-subscene objects. Seems to be an issue with empty paths, as I can add scripts to scene objects (which have a path for the scene file and naturally suggest an appropriately-named script file), but not for primitive objects.

Steps to reproduce:
- Set thread model to "single-unsafe"
- Add an Area node to your project
- Select the Area node in the "scene" tab
- Click the add-script icon
- click the ellipsis on the resultant dialog
- watch it crash

1.Show a message that no Node is selected
2.Select root node automatically after delete?

data.title: Open scenes automatically on "Open Project"
data.body: Save all open scenes on "Editor/Project close" and re-open on "project start".

data.title: Freeing a Joint/Joint2D throws "Invalid ID"
data.body:
Something I noticed, is when a Joint has rigid bodies as nodes a, and b, when freeing the joint, the physics server (PhysicsServerSW) throws "Invalid ID", I don't know what this will cause, but my other scenes seem to be unstable, joints randomly don't connect, and the simulation isn't consistent.

*Bugsquad edit:* Initial issue was fixed, but still doesn't work with Joint2D-s.

data.title: compiling android export template on Windows 7 32bit error
data.body: the error is os_android.os. please help regarding this. im not able to release game on playstore without admob. so im planning to create android export template.

data.title: Dictionary.erase() not working : could be a parse_json() bug
data.body:
Related topic : http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&p=11433

Problem : 
Erasing key from a dictionary extracted from a JSON file seems not to be working.

How to reproduce :
Create a new empty project, add a "Control node" and attach a new script to it then past the following script :

``` python

extends Control


func _ready():
    var strJSON = '{"last edited":"0", "script":{"1%3a%20Demo-tan":{"1%3a%20Virtual%20Realm":{"3":{}, "4":{}, "5":{}, "0":{"0":"This%20is%20an%20example%20text"}, "1":{"0":"demotan-helpful"}, "2":{}}, "2%3a%20Thinking%20Room":{"3":{"0":"Yes%2c%20this%20feature%20looks%20sufficient."}, "4":{"0":"Where%27s%20the%20action%3f%21"}, "5":{"0":"Choices%20are%20handled%20in%20game%20code."}, "0":{"0":"Am%20I%20supposed%20to%20show%20you%20the%20question%20example%20here%3f"}, "1":{"1":"demotan-confused"}, "2":{"0":"I%20think%20so...%3f"}}}, '
    strJSON += '"2%3a%20Demo-kun":{"2%3a%20Earth%20%28dining%20hall%29":{"3":{}, "4":{}, "5":{}, "0":{"0":"For%20now%20portraits%20have%20to%20be%20added%20manually"}, "1":{"1":"demokun-relieved"}, "2":{}}, "1%3a%20Virtual%20Realm%20%28closet%29":{"3":{}, "4":{}, "5":{}, "0":{"0":"Questions%20are%20rather%20strained%20for", "1":"If%20the%20answers%20are%20left%20blank."}, "1":{"0":"demokun-helpful"}, "2":{}}}}, "portraits":{"3":"demotan-warning", "0":"demotan-helpful", "1":"demotan-confused", "2":"demokun-helpful"}}'
    var dictio = {}
    dictio.parse_json(strJSON.percent_decode())

    printt("SSIZE", dictio.size())
    for i in dictio["script"].keys():
        print(i)
    print("\n")

    print(dictio["script"])
    print("\n")

    print("DEBUT1")
    print(dictio["script"]["2: Demo-kun"])
    print("\n")

    dictio["script"].erase("2: Demo-kun")

    print("DEBUT2")
    print(dictio["script"]["2: Demo-kun"])
    print("\n")

    dictio["script"].erase("2: Demo-kun")
    dictio["script"].erase("2: Demo-kun")

    print("DEBUT3")
    print(dictio["script"]["2: Demo-kun"])
    print("\n")

    pass
```

Output:

```
SSIZE   3
2: Demo-kun
1: Demo-tan

(1: Demo-tan:(1: Virtual Realm:(0:(0:This is an example text)), (1:(0:demotan-helpful)), (2:), (3:), (4:), (5:)), (2: Thinking Room:(0:(0:Am I supposed to show you the question example here?)), (1:(1:demotan-confused)), (2:(0:I think so...?)), (3:(0:Yes, this feature looks sufficient.)), (4:(0:Where's the action?!)), (5:(0:Choices are handled in game code.)))), (2: Demo-kun:(1: Virtual Realm (closet):(0:(0:Questions are rather strained for), (1:If the answers are left blank.)), (1:(0:demokun-helpful)), (2:), (3:), (4:), (5:)), (2: Earth (dining hall):(0:(0:For now portraits have to be added manually)), (1:(1:demokun-relieved)), (2:), (3:), (4:), (5:)))



DEBUT1
(1: Virtual Realm (closet):(0:(0:Questions are rather strained for), (1:If the answers are left blank.)), (1:(0:demokun-helpful)), (2:), (3:), (4:), (5:)), (2: Earth (dining hall):(0:(0:For now portraits have to be added manually)), (1:(1:demokun-relieved)), (2:), (3:), (4:), (5:))


DEBUT2
(1: Virtual Realm (closet):(0:(0:Questions are rather strained for), (1:If the answers are left blank.)), (1:(0:demokun-helpful)), (2:), (3:), (4:), (5:)), (2: Earth (dining hall):(0:(0:For now portraits have to be added manually)), (1:(1:demokun-relieved)), (2:), (3:), (4:), (5:))


DEBUT3
(1: Virtual Realm (closet):(0:(0:Questions are rather strained for), (1:If the answers are left blank.)), (1:(0:demokun-helpful)), (2:), (3:), (4:), (5:)), (2: Earth (dining hall):(0:(0:For now portraits have to be added manually)), (1:(1:demokun-relieved)), (2:), (3:), (4:), (5:))
```

As you can see, erasing seems not to be working, even by trying to erase() twice as stated in the forum topic.

Here is the corresponding JSON script with indentation: 

``` json
{
    "last edited":"0", 

    "script":{
        "1%3a%20Demo-tan":{
            "1%3a%20Virtual%20Realm":{
                "3":{}, 
                "4":{}, 
                "5":{}, 
                "0":{"0":"This%20is%20an%20example%20text.%20%0aThe%20bottom%20displays%20the%20example%20%0aas%20it%20should%20look%20at%202x%20zoom."}, 
                "1":{"0":"demotan-helpful"}, 
                "2":{}
            }, 
            "2%3a%20Thinking%20Room":{
                "3":{"0":"Yes%2c%20this%20feature%20looks%20sufficient."}, 
                "4":{"0":"Where%27s%20the%20action%3f%21"}, 
                "5":{"0":"Choices%20are%20handled%20in%20game%20code."}, 
                "0":{"0":"Am%20I%20supposed%20to%20show%20you%20the%20question%20example%20here%3f"}, 
                "1":{"1":"demotan-confused"}, 
                "2":{"0":"I%20think%20so...%3f"}
            }
        }, 
        "2%3a%20Demo-kun":{
            "2%3a%20Earth%20%28dining%20hall%29":{
                "3":{}, 
                "4":{}, 
                "5":{}, 
                "0":{"0":"For%20now%20portraits%20have%20to%20be%20added%20manually%20as%20nodes%20before%20compilation%21%0aLoading%20and%20saving%20portraits%20is%20not%20yet%20supported%2c%20but%20there%20are%20plans%20to%20change%20this."}, 
                "1":{"1":"demokun-relieved"}, 
                "2":{}
            }, 
            "1%3a%20Virtual%20Realm%20%28closet%29":{
                "3":{}, 
                "4":{}, 
                "5":{}, 
                "0":{"0":"Questions%20are%20rather%20strained%20for%20size%2c%20so%20it%20is%20best%20to%20be%20succinct%20and%20use%20the%20preview%20to%20gauge%20how%20long%20the%20message%20is.", "1":"If%20the%20answers%20are%20left%20blank%20it%20will%20stay%20in%20message%20mode%2c%20but%20for%20any%20that%20are%20filled%2c%20it%20will%20go%20into%20question%20mode.%20It%20will%20only%20display%20the%20answers%20you%20have%20filled%20out."}, 
                "1":{"0":"demokun-helpful"}, 
                "2":{}
            }
        }
    },

    "portraits":{
        "3":"demotan-warning", 
        "0":"demotan-helpful", 
        "1":"demotan-confused", 
        "2":"demokun-helpful"
    }
}
```

data.title: Tab close button + display policies + application on Scenes Tabs
data.body:
- Added close button to tabs [x].
- Added 4 display policies for this close button (SHOW_ALWAYS, SHOW_NEVER, SHOW_ACTIVE_ONLY, SHOW_HOVER). 
- Set the scene tabs in editor to follow the hover policy.

Note : the 4 policies listed above only apply to close button. right_button (used for Script button in scene tabs) are always displayed.

data.title: OptionButton and national characters
data.body:
When using OptionButton and national characters, the list does not work properly.
http://www.picshare.ru/view/6668736/

Letters (labels) are displayed only on the button. On discharge letter list are not displayed!

data.title: Data types in code completion
data.body: Sometimes I have to jump into the Help tab to know the returning data type (or property data type) and it slows me down. It would be helpful if code completion showed me data type next to the function/property name.

data.title: Fix for shader bug on window re-sizing when using stretch mode "viewport"
data.body:
Fix for #1571 and #2342 shader problem when using stretch mode "viewport" and re-sizing the window.

-Edit-
Before: http://gfycat.com/MistySpotlessGadwall (1.1 Stable)
After: http://gfycat.com/GrimAlarmedAphid
